channel.title: Algebra 2 Word Problem
channel.description:
An Airplane's altitude is 100 ft as it is descending for a landing on a runway whose touchdown point is 5000 ft away. Let the x-axis represent the distance on the ground and the y-axis represent the airplane's altitude.
what is the slope of the airplane's descent?
What is the y-intercept of the airplanes descent?
Write an equation of the line that follows the path of the airplanes descent.
Im pretty sure the y intercept is 100 but i don't know for a fact please any help would be greatly appreciated with an explanation on how to work out the answer. ;D

item.title: Algebra 2 Word Problem
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Slope is the rise over run of a line. Mathematically, m = Δy/Δx (change in y / change in x). In this case, Δy = 100 and Δx is 5000. Thus, m = 100/5000 = 1/50

As for the y-intercept, it depends how you write your graph. You could start at x = 0 with the plane at y = 100, or you could have the landing point as the origin. For the former example, the y-intercept would indeed be y = 100. For the later, it would be y = 0.

Read full topic
